text: in this video we're going to focus on
dimensional analysis how to convert from

so let's start with this problem
how many seconds are there in a year

good to start with what you're given in
this case one year
now what we want to do is we want to
convert years

and then days
into
hours

and then minutes into seconds

well
one year
contains 365 days
now we're not going to take a leap here
into an account
so it's about 365.
one could say it's
we'll keep it at 365 just to keep things
simple
now how many hours are in a single day
one day
contains 24 hours
so notice the way that i'm setting up
the problem
i'm setting up the units in such a way
that they cancel
in the end the only unit that i want

now we need to convert hours into

so we know that there's 60 minutes in

bottom
60 minutes on top
finally we need to convert

one minute
contains 60 seconds
so now we could cancel the unit hours
and we could cancel the unit minutes
now let's do the math
so we're going to multiply by all the
numbers on top it's going to be 1 times
times 24 times 60 times 60.
so the answer is pretty big it's
31 million
seconds
so that's how many seconds

that is 30 feet

to
5280 feet

and so we have

now the last thing we need to do is

there's 60 minutes

so times 60 times 60.

using dimensional analysis
here's another problem
and the ratio of boys to girls in a
certain classroom is four to five
if there are 36 boys how many girls are
there in this class
so what do you think we need to do in
this problem
well we could get the answer simply by

let's start with what we're given
we know that there's 36 boys in the
classroom
our conversion factor is the ratio
of boys to girls
so for every four boys in this classroom
we could say that there's five girls
and we could use that to convert from
boys to girls in the next fraction
so we're going to put this on the bottom
and the other part of the conversion

so if we set up the problem in this
manner
we can get the number of girls in this
classroom so it's gonna be 36 divided by
4 which is 9
times 5
and so that's 45.
so there are 45 girls in this classroom
so dimensional analysis is very useful
for solving problems

problems there's a lot of things you can
